locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the context of Isaiah's 'new thing' and Jesus' response to John the Baptist regarding the blind, lame, and poor.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong thematic exegesis; links the 'pause' of Christmas to the theological concept of letting go.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from identifying the audience (Assertive) to announcing God's action (Commissive/Declarative) and inviting acceptance (Directive).
voorbeelden: Behold I am doing a new thing.
The gospel to all who are blind is to receive new eyes.
God has declared a general amnesty.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer lets go of the past (guilt/shame) and experiences the 'newness' of God's grace as a present reality.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit; the preacher refers to the 'power of the gospel at work' and the 'gift' that must be seized.

voorbeelden: Christmas is not finally about a baby.
The world did not expect the gift of the gospel.
Name the place in your life that is like that.
Join the miracle, notice the gift, receive new life.
We enjoy it either way, in anger or in guilt.
God will make available to us our best treasured life.
Behold, I am doing a new thing.
God has made a move toward new power.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High; the preacher uses God's own speech to bind God to the hearer's present situation.

voorbeelden: God has declared a general amnesty on old bills unpaid.
The old guilt has been forgiven.
This is the word of the gospel for you today.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Strong; the preacher speaks as a mandatory of the Gospel, declaring the 'amnesty' as a current fact.

indicatoren: Historical descriptions of Isaiah's world are used only as a springboard for the present address.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is grounded in the story before being addressed by it.

missende_elementen: Could benefit from more direct 'I' language in the declaration (e.g., 'I declare to you...').
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: None; the 'You' address is very strong.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Excellent; uses the 'Gospel to the [category]' structure to apply grace specifically.
voorbeelden: The gospel to all who are blind is to receive new eyes.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Used for personal anecdotes and establishing the preacher's initial uncertainty.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Extremely high; the sermon is a direct address ('This sermon is for you').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to deliver the promise and the amnesty directly to the hearer.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Used to describe the 'world' and 'former things' to be abandoned.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a distance between the hearer and their 'old life'.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (The list of the broken) -> Declarative (God has declared amnesty) -> Commissive (God is doing a new thing for you) -> Directive (Seize it).
voorbeelden: The gospel to all the poor is... God has declared a general amnesty... receive new life.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Very high; the imperative 'receive' is entirely founded on the declarative 'amnesty'.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: The reason we may forget (Imperative) what is old, is that it is being powerfully displaced (Indicative).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as an event of 'newness' by repeatedly declaring the end of the old and the start of the new in the second person.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: This sermon is not for you, unless...
sterke_punten.effect: Forces the hearer to self-identify as the recipient of grace.

zwakke_punten.probleem: The Holy Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of perlocution.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon does not just talk about a new thing; it attempts to be the 'new thing' by speaking it into existence for the hearer.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'amnesty' declaration is a classic declarative act that changes the hearer's status before God.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes; 'God has spoken that word to us'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes; the preacher delivers the 'amnesty' on God's behalf.
tekstueel_bewijs: God has declared a general amnesty.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, through the 'power of the gospel'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes; the hearer is told they 'may seize it', acknowledging the response is beyond the preacher's control.
tekstueel_bewijs: And you may seize it. You may decide.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes; the sermon is treated as the 'move' God makes toward the world.
tekstueel_bewijs: God has made a move toward new power in the world.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is remarkably performative, with a high density of commissives and declaratives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God has declared a general amnesty.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus, I declare God's amnesty to you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a third-person report of God's act to a first-person ministerial act.

voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you, your old debts are gone.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: The 'unless' opening is a masterclass in performative engagement.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a premier example of how to avoid 'talking about' God and instead 'doing' the Gospel through the Word.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (loneliness in the restaurant); SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the amnesty regardless of the preacher's feelings.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would focus on the beauty of the 'blind/lame' metaphors; SAT focuses on the fact that these metaphors are 'Commissives' that bind God to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Amnesty' (Declarative) which creates the 'New Thing' it describes.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God has declared a general amnesty on old bills unpaid.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'negative-entry' performative (This is not for you unless...) to create an irresistible illocutionary hook.
